result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie A Grunert

records.addlTxt:
2:37 PM Defendant Stephanie A Grunert in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Stephanie A Grunert. 
Atty Nimmer requests a new date to allow defendant to complete evaluation. 
State does not object.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:07 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  Defendant Stephanie A Grunert in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Stephanie A Grunert. 
Atty Nimmer updates the court with the status and requests a new date.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

12:13 PM Defendant Stephanie A Grunert in court by zoom from NOVA counseling center. with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Nimmer has received a copy of the amended complaint, waive reading and enter not guilty plea. 
Atty Nimmer just did find out her client went into treatment and would like more time to speak with her client.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on August 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Stephanie A Grunert
Current: 800 W Abbot Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53221 United States  (Effective: 07-21-2022)
Prior: S75w20029 Ridge Rd, Muskego, WI 53150
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

01:24 PM Defendant Stephanie A Grunert in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes the stayed warrant.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  State to file the information.  Court sets an arraignment date before the Trial Court.  Arraignment scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

09:53 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court.   Defendant Stephanie A Grunert did not appear.   State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.  Attorney Nimmer requests an imposed and stayed capias stating she spoke to the defendants mother and that they were attempting to get the defendant a new phone to get in touch with her.  Attorney Nimmer states she did inform the State they could cancel their witness for today and if the defendant appeared and wished to have a preliminary hearing they could have rescheduled.  The Court will allow an adjournment and set this matter on a lockup calendar for a status date.  Time limits previously waived.  Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Atty Amanda appointed as Public Defender
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:18 PM Defendant Stephanie A Grunert in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.

The Court will issue a $1,000.00 arrest warrant.
